source.p: To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

div.p:
Welcome to Wahpeton Public School
District. My name is Rick Jacobson and I am
the Superintendent of Schools for our
beautiful district. We truly appreciate
the time you have taken to visit
our website. We hope that you
will find the information within
our site useful and informative.

td.br:
The week of April 14 – 17 marks the fifth week of school closures in North Dakota due to the COVID19 virus. Distance learning continues for all K-12 students in Wahpeton. As of right now, ND schools will remained closed indefinitely. I am assuming a more definitive answer concerning the status of school closures in ND will be forthcoming in the next week or two. School across the state have been anxiously awaiting for a set response from Gov. Burgum’s office as to whether or not schools will re-open yet this spring. Contingent on his response, high school spring activities, PROM, Graduation, etc. are on hold as well. At some point in the very near future, decisions need to be made so schools can create a different set of deadlines. At our Wed., April 8, 2020 Zoom school board meeting, the topic of Graduation was discussed. As of the 8th, it is the intent of the school board to have some type of graduation ceremony sometime this summer if allowable, however, this is still up in the air depending what guidelines everyone is still forced to comply with.
Open to continue reading...

On Monday, March 30, Gov. Burgum issued an Executive Order to keep North Dakota K-12 schools closed indefinitely. This means that all school buildings and property are closed to outside personnel until further notice. Also, Gov. Burgum required all ND schools to submit a Distance Learning Plan by March 31. The Wahpeton Public School distance learning plan was approved by the Gov. on Monday, March 30, 2020.

td.a: Teacher of the Year & Classified Employee of the Year 2019-20
td.br:
Each year Wahpeton Public Schools Teachers and Classified Employees are nominated for Teacher of the Year & Classified Employee of the Year. Open the this news story and watch the video to see who the nominees are.
Congratulations to Dana Kasowski, Teacher of the Year
Congratulations to Scott Albertson, Classified Employee of the Year

td.a: Wahpeton Public Schools COVID-19 Response Plan
td.br: The ND Department of Instruction has asked all schools to create a plan in response to COVID-19. This plan includes procedures for short and long term school building closure. This response will also detail Wahpeton Public Schools efforts to ensure all students have equitable learning opportunities during distance learning. Our plan is now APPROVED by Gov. Bergum & ND DPI. Please open this article to see the complete plan in PDF.
